title: Register application namespace in Operations Platform
content:
The application services need to access Operations Platform to ensure that communication from the application services running within the same Kubernetes cluster and cross namespace is allowed. For application services to access Operations Platform, register the respective application namespaces in Operations Platform. Only the registered namespaces have authorized access.

To ensure that only the registered namespaces can request certificates, use op-tms-cli to register your application namespace.

When you register your application's namespace in Operations Platform, it automatically handles the RE CA certificate exchange. 

Register an application namespace

The Tenant Management Service CLI, op-tms-cli manages the tenant lifecycle and supports application namespace registration. You can find the op-tms-cli-<version>.tar.gz file in the directory where you have unzipped the op-chart-<version>.zip file, under the subdirectory structure, op-chart\tools\op-tms-cli\.

To unzip the file, you can copy the file op-tms-cli-<version>.tar.gz file from the tools/op-tms-cli subdirectory to a directory of your choice or you can unzip it in the parent directory, op-tms-cli.

Run the following command to unzip the <op-tms-cli-xx.x.x-xx.tar.gz> file:

tar -xvf op-tms-cli-xx.x.x-xx.tar.gz

To register your application namespace:

On the bastion node where Operations Platform is installed, navigate to the directory where you unzipped op-tms-cli and run the following command:

./op-tms-cli tenant register --appnamespace <namespace> --opnamespace <opnamespace>

where,

<namespace>: application namespace, ensure that you use the same application namespace that you created. For example, opsb and nom.

<opnamespace>: namespace you created for Operations Platform installation.

Example:

AI Operations Management:

./op-tms-cli tenant register --appnamespace opsb --opnamespace op

Network Operations Management:

./op-tms-cli tenant register --appnamespace nom --opnamespace op

Here, the response is shown for AI Operations Management, you will see a similar response for Network Operations Management:

------------------- Starting OP-TMS-CLI-Tool -------------------
NOTE: This tool has to be executed on Bastion host of Managed K8S or Control plane node of Operations Platform Embedded K8S Cluster
 
Registering Application namespace -> 'opsb', Tenant name -> 'Provider', with Operations Platform namespace -> 'op'
Successfully registered application namespace 'opsb' -> tenant 'Provider'

In this example, the application namespace is registered with the default tenant 'Provider'.
